content:
Fresh dill is a fantastic addition to Tzatziki Sauce, and it pairs beautifully with cucumbers and feta. In fact, dill is a traditional herb used in many Greek recipes, including Tzatziki Sauce.

Using fresh dill from your garden will add a bright, fresh flavor to your sauce. You can use either the leaves or the stems, or a combination of both. Here are some tips for incorporating fresh dill into your Tzatziki Sauce recipe:

1. **Chop the dill finely:** Mince the fresh dill leaves and stems to release their oils and flavor. You can chop them by hand or use a food processor to get a fine texture.
2. **Use the right amount:** Start with a small amount of dill, about 1-2 tablespoons of chopped fresh dill per cup of yogurt. You can always add more to taste, but it's easier to add more than it is to remove excess dill flavor.
3. **Add it at the right time:** Mix the chopped dill into the yogurt, cucumber, and garlic mixture towards the end of the preparation process. This will help preserve the delicate flavor and aroma of the dill.
4. **Combine with garlic:** Dill and garlic are a classic pairing in many Greek recipes. Mince 1-2 cloves of garlic and mix it with the chopped dill before adding it to the yogurt mixture.
5. **Taste and adjust:** As with any recipe, taste the Tzatziki Sauce as you go and adjust the seasoning to your liking. You can add more dill, garlic, lemon juice, or salt to taste.

Using fresh dill from your garden will elevate the flavor of your Tzatziki Sauce and add a beautiful, fresh aroma. Enjoy!
